text: The time between customer arrivals at a coffee shop follows an exponential distribution with λ = 0.2 customers per minute. What is the probability that the next customer will arrive within 3 minutes?
A light bulb manufacturer claims their bulbs have an average lifespan of 800 hours with exponential distribution. What is the probability that a bulb will last more than 1000 hours?
The time between earthquakes in a certain region follows an exponential distribution with mean 50 years. What is the probability that the next earthquake occurs within the next 30 years?
A server processes requests with exponential service time averaging 2 minutes per request. What is the probability that a request takes more than 3 minutes to process?
The memoryless property of exponential distribution means that if a component has survived 1000 hours, the probability it survives another 500 hours is the same as:
explanation: Memoryless property: P(X > s+t | X > s) = P(X > t). So P(survive another 500 | survived 1000) = P(survive 500)

text: A radioactive element decays exponentially with half-life of 10 years. What is the decay rate parameter λ?
explanation: Half-life = ln(2)/λ = 10 years, so λ = ln(2)/10 = 0.693/10 = 0.0693 per year

text: The time between customer complaints follows exponential distribution with mean 20 days. What is the probability that the next complaint occurs between 10 and 30 days from now?
If X ~ Exp(λ), what is the 90th percentile of the distribution?
explanation: For exponential distribution, x_α = -ln(α)/λ where α = 1 - percentile. For 90th percentile, α = 0.1, so x = -ln(0.1)/λ

text: A call center receives calls exponentially with mean time between calls of 5 minutes. What is the probability that no calls are received in a 10-minute period?
The variance of an exponential distribution with parameter λ = 0.25 is:
explanation: For exponential distribution, variance = 1/λ² = 1/(0.25)² = 1/0.0625 = 16

text: A gamma distribution with α = 1 and β = 1/λ is equivalent to:
explanation: When α = 1 and β = 1/λ, the gamma distribution reduces to the exponential distribution with parameter λ

text: For a gamma distribution with α = 3 and β = 2, what is the mean?
explanation: For gamma distribution, mean = αβ = 3 × 2 = 6

text: For a gamma distribution with α = 3 and β = 2, what is the variance?
explanation: For gamma distribution, variance = αβ² = 3 × (2)² = 3 × 4 = 12

text: The time to complete a complex task follows a gamma distribution with α = 4 and β = 0.5 hours. What is the expected completion time?
explanation: Mean = αβ = 4 × 0.5 = 2 hours

text: If X ~ Gamma(α, β), what happens to the shape of the distribution as α increases?
options: It becomes more symmetric and bell-shaped
explanation: As α increases, the gamma distribution becomes more symmetric and approaches a normal distribution shape

text: The sum of n independent exponential random variables with parameter λ follows:
options: Gamma distribution with α = n, β = 1/λ
explanation: The sum of n i.i.d. exponential(λ) random variables follows a gamma distribution with α = n and β = 1/λ

text: A gamma distribution is used to model the time until the 5th customer arrival when arrivals are Poisson with rate 2 per hour. What are the parameters α and β?
explanation: Time until kth event in Poisson process follows gamma(k, 1/λ). Here k = 5, λ = 2, so α = 5, β = 1/λ = 0.5

text: The gamma function Γ(5) equals:
explanation: Γ(n) = (n-1)! for positive integers, so Γ(5) = 4! = 24

text: Γ(1/2) equals:
explanation: By definition, Γ(1/2) = √π

text: For a gamma distribution with α = 2.5 and β = 4, what is the mean?
The time between system failures follows exponential distribution with mean 100 hours. What is the probability that the system fails within 50 hours?
If P(X > 20) = 0.3679 for an exponential distribution, what is the value of λ?
The moment generating function of exponential distribution with parameter λ is:
explanation: MGF of exponential(λ) is M(t) = λ/(λ-t) for t < λ

text: A gamma distribution with α = 1 is equivalent to:
explanation: When α = 1, gamma distribution reduces to exponential distribution

text: The time to process insurance claims follows gamma distribution with α = 3 and β = 2 days. What is the probability that a claim takes more than 8 days to process?
explanation: This requires integration of the gamma PDF from 8 to ∞. Alternatively, using the relationship with Poisson process: P(X > 8) = P(fewer than 3 events in time 8) where events occur at rate 1/β = 0.5 per day. P(X > 8) = P(Y < 3) where Y ~ Poisson(0.5×8=4) = P(Y=0)+P(Y=1)+P(Y=2) = e^(-4)(1 + 4 + 8) = 13e^(-4) = 13×0.0183 = 0.2381

text: The memoryless property is unique to:
explanation: The memoryless property is unique to exponential distribution (continuous) and geometric distribution (discrete)

text: If the time between earthquakes follows exponential distribution with mean 30 years, what is the probability that the next earthquake occurs after 40 years but before 60 years?
A gamma distribution with α = 2.5 and β = 4 has variance:
The time between customer arrivals follows exponential distribution. If the probability of no arrivals in 10 minutes is 0.3679, what is the average time between arrivals?
For a gamma distribution, when α is a positive integer, the CDF can be related to:
explanation: For gamma distribution with integer α, P(X ≤ x) = P(Y ≥ α) where Y ~ Poisson(x/β)

text: A system has components with exponentially distributed lifetimes (mean = 100 hours). What is the probability that at least one of two independent components fails within 50 hours?
explanation: P(component fails within 50 hrs) = 1-e^(-0.5)=0.3935. P(at least one fails) = 1-P(both survive) = 1-(0.6065)² = 1-0.3679=0.6321

text: The gamma distribution is often used to model:
options: Time until kth event in Poisson process
Number of events in fixed time interval
explanation: Gamma distribution models the waiting time until the kth event in a Poisson process

text: If X ~ Exp(λ), then Y = kX (for k > 0) follows:
explanation: For exponential distribution, scaling by k gives another exponential with parameter λ/k

text: The median of exponential distribution with parameter λ is:
explanation: Median is the solution to 1-e^(-λm)=0.5, so e^(-λm)=0.5, thus m = -ln(0.5)/λ = ln(2)/λ

text: For gamma distribution with α = 4 and β = 3, the mode is:
explanation: Mode of gamma distribution = (α-1)β = (4-1)×3 = 3×3 = 9

text: The skewness of exponential distribution is:
explanation: Exponential distribution has skewness = 2

text: If X ~ Gamma(α, β), then kX (for k > 0) follows:
explanation: Scaling a gamma random variable by k gives another gamma with the same shape parameter α but scaled scale parameter kβ

text: The probability density function of gamma distribution includes the term x^(α-1). This means the distribution has mode at 0 when:
explanation: When α ≤ 1, the PDF is decreasing and has mode at 0

text: The relationship between exponential and Poisson distributions is that:
options: Time between Poisson events is exponential
Number of exponential events in time is Poisson
explanation: All statements are true: time between Poisson events is exponential, count of exponential events in time is Poisson, and both distributions exhibit memoryless property

text: The gamma function Γ(n) for positive integer n is equivalent to:
explanation: For positive integers, Γ(n) = (n-1)!
